item.title: Understanding The Role Of Compounding Pharmacies After Dozens Of Deaths
item.description: March 26, 2017 - The co-owner of a compounding pharmacy has been convicted of fraud and racketeering, five years after contamination at his pharmacy killed at least 64 people and sickened hundreds of others.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - The co-owner of a compounding pharmacy has been convicted of fraud and racketeering, five years after contamination at his pharmacy killed at least 64 people and sickened hundreds of others. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/26/521550383/understanding-the-role-of-compounding-pharmacies-after-dozens-of-deaths

item.title: Trendy Hospital Clothing To Make Cancer Patients Dress 'Well' Even When Unwell
item.description: March 26, 2017 - A trio of European women has launched INGA Wellbeing fashion line to help alleviate the dehumanizing experience many patients endure when wearing the traditional, uncomfortable hospital gowns.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - A trio of European women has launched INGA Wellbeing fashion line to help alleviate the dehumanizing experience many patients endure when wearing the traditional, uncomfortable hospital gowns. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/26/521271203/trendy-hospital-clothing-to-make-cancer-patients-dress-well-even-when-unwell

item.title: Telehealth Doctor Visits May Be Handy, But Aren't Cheaper Overall
item.description: March 26, 2017 - Many patients like the convenience of being able to quickly consult a doctor by text or phone or webcam instead of heading to an urgent care clinic. But the cost of consultations can add up.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - Many patients like the convenience of being able to quickly consult a doctor by text or phone or webcam instead of heading to an urgent care clinic. But the cost of consultations can add up. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/26/519543337/telehealth-doctor-visits-may-be-handy-but-arent-cheaper-overall

item.title: QUIZ: How Much Do You Know About Global Pandemics And Killer Viruses?
item.description:
March 26, 2017 - We live in a hyperinfectious era. Test your knowledge of the diseases all around us.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/26/521362938/quiz-how-much-do-you-know-about-global-pandemics-and-killer-viruses
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - We live in a hyperinfectious era. Test your knowledge of the diseases all around us. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/03/26/521362938/quiz-how-much-do-you-know-about-global-pandemics-and-killer-viruses

item.title: States Give New Parents Baby Boxes To Encourge Safe Sleep Habits
item.description: March 26, 2017 - The baby boxes that Finland gives to all new mothers are legendary. Now states in the U.S. are experimenting with them as a way to encourage safe sleep practices and reduce SIDS.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 26, 2017 - The baby boxes that Finland gives to all new mothers are legendary. Now states in the U.S. are experimenting with them as a way to encourage safe sleep practices and reduce SIDS. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/26/521399385/states-give-new-parents-baby-boxes-to-encourge-safe-sleep-habits

item.title: Failed House Vote Is 'A Great Opportunity' For Republicans, Former House Leader Says
item.description: March 25, 2017 - "Now we can back up and do the things that should have been done," Republican Tom DeLay says. The former House Majority Leader discusses what the withdrawal of the AHCA means for his party's future.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - "Now we can back up and do the things that should have been done," Republican Tom DeLay says. The former House Majority Leader discusses what the withdrawal of the AHCA means for his party's future. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521512812/failed-house-vote-is-a-great-opportunity-for-republicans-former-house-leader-say

item.title: DNC Chair On ACHA Withdrawal: 'It Was A Good Day For The Good Guys'
item.description: March 25, 2017 - DNC Chair Tom Perez reacts to Trump's statement that Democrats are responsible for the ACA repeal failure, which Perez calls a good moment for 24 million who were going to lose their health insurance.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - DNC Chair Tom Perez reacts to Trump's statement that Democrats are responsible for the ACA repeal failure, which Perez calls a good moment for 24 million who were going to lose their health insurance. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521517131/dnc-chair-on-acha-withdrawal-it-was-a-good-day-for-the-good-guys

item.title: What Does Failed Repeal Of Affordable Care Act Mean For Current Health Care Law?
item.description: March 25, 2017 - House Republicans have backed away from the American Health Care Act. Mary Agnes Carey, senior correspondent at Kaiser Health News, breaks down what this means for the current health care law
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - House Republicans have backed away from the American Health Care Act. Mary Agnes Carey, senior correspondent at Kaiser Health News, breaks down what this means for the current health care law http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521517124/what-does-failed-repeal-of-affordable-care-act-mean-for-current-health-care-law

item.title: Brain Tumor Defense For Jewish Center Bomb Threat Suspect Recalls 1991 Murder Trial
item.description: March 25, 2017 - Ken Davis's book, "The Brain Defense," looks at the murder trial of Herbert Weinstein, in which lawyers argued that Weinstein was not guilty of killing his wife, because he had a brain tumor.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - Ken Davis's book, "The Brain Defense," looks at the murder trial of Herbert Weinstein, in which lawyers argued that Weinstein was not guilty of killing his wife, because he had a brain tumor. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/25/521517166/lawyers-brain-tumor-defense-for-jewish-center-bomb-threat-suspect-recalls-1991-m

item.title: VP Pence On Obamacare Repeal Failure: 'Congress Just Wasn't Ready'
item.description: March 25, 2017 - The Vice President was in West Virginia a day after the GOP's Affordable Care Act repeal efforts were scrapped. He joked that maybe some WWE superstars were needed on Capitol Hill.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - The Vice President was in West Virginia a day after the GOP's Affordable Care Act repeal efforts were scrapped. He joked that maybe some WWE superstars were needed on Capitol Hill. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/03/25/521511682/vp-pence-on-obamacare-repeal-failure-congress-just-wasnt-ready

item.title: Los Angeles Health Clinic 'A Microcosm' Of The Nation's Anxieties
item.description: March 25, 2017 - A South LA clinic started by Muslim doctors and students has served mostly low-income Latino and African-American patients for 20 years. Staff and patients now say they worry about their future.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - A South LA clinic started by Muslim doctors and students has served mostly low-income Latino and African-American patients for 20 years. Staff and patients now say they worry about their future. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/03/25/520813613/los-angeles-health-clinic-a-microcosm-of-the-nations-anxieties

item.title: The Pregame PB&J: How The Comfort Food Became The NBA's Recipe For Success
item.description: March 25, 2017 - "If there's a locker room that doesn't have it, I haven't seen it," says ESPN reporter Baxter Holmes, who expands on his recent story, which details professional basketball's obsession with the snack.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 25, 2017 - "If there's a locker room that doesn't have it, I haven't seen it," says ESPN reporter Baxter Holmes, who expands on his recent story, which details professional basketball's obsession with the snack. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/03/25/521256918/the-pregame-pb-j-how-the-comfort-food-became-the-nbas-recipe-for-success

item.title: Health Care Bill Collapses After Republicans Fail To Garner Enough Support
item.description: March 24, 2017 - Republicans pulled their health care bill on Friday after failing to secure enough votes for it to pass in the House. In a statement, President Trump said he wanted to move onto tax reform.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 24, 2017 - Republicans pulled their health care bill on Friday after failing to secure enough votes for it to pass in the House. In a statement, President Trump said he wanted to move onto tax reform. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/24/521435940/health-care-bill-collapses-after-republicans-fail-to-garner-enough-support

item.title: Trump, Ryan Pull Health Care Bill After Failing To Secure Enough Votes
item.description: March 24, 2017 - Republicans pulled their bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act on Friday after failing to secure enough votes for it to pass in the House of Representatives.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: March 24, 2017 - Republicans pulled their bill to repeal and replace the Affordable Care Act on Friday after failing to secure enough votes for it to pass in the House of Representatives. http://www.npr.org/2017/03/24/521435192/trump-ryan-pull-health-care-bill-after-failing-to-secure-enough-votes

item.title: Rep. Byrne Outlines How Health Care Fight Exposed Divisions In GOP
item.description:
March 24, 2017 - NPR's Kelly McEvers talks to Republican Rep. Bradley Byrne about the decision to pull the Republican health care bill on Friday.
- http://www.npr.org/2017/03/24/521427810/rep-byrne-outlines-how-health-care-fight-exposed-divisions-in-gop
